chunks.chunk_text: 想知道薪水入帳後該如何管理投資新手又該何時入場出國旅遊怎麼玩追什麼我是蔡尚樺邀請您來收聽玉山銀行全新Podcast玉山學堂在這裡我將和不同世代的來賓一起聊投資談消費分享最實用的理財觀念讓理財不只是數字而是更輕鬆更有趣的生活方式現在就點擊連結收聽一起開啟幸福人生

chunks.chunk_text: Hello guys, welcome to Type It Banter, where John and Gavin uncover the interesting trends and issues around the world. Coming up!
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: Is this a very sad episode?Are we gonna cry like babies?No, no, no. This was surprising. When I first looked at the title, I thought, but it is quite interesting.All right. So buddy, let's recap quickly. Museum of broken relationships.Well, let me give you the background. Basically what happened, the original is from Croatia.The original museum was in Croatia and basically what happened, two artists had a relationship and they broke up and they didn't know what to do with the stuff that was left.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: You know, like my sock, your sock, this DVD we bought together, these books.So they created a museum and they put it there.And then somebody from Los Angeles in America saw this, thought, what a great idea.And in LA, they opened a museum.And this article is about the museum in America.Okay.And basically it's weird.It sounds strange, but it's basically it's a museum that accepts international goodies.So if you have something with a great story from a broken relationship, you can send it
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: to them and they will display it anonymously.And they will write, you have to write the story.So there are interesting objects there from relationships that were broken.So it is very odd.Most people would think it's quite boring.They actually use the word mundane in the article.We'll discuss that a bit later.So even things that are like an iron, there's a one about an iron where some gentleman from, let me think, if I remember
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: right, was from Germany who sent an iron.And he basically said, I use this iron to iron my wedding suit before I got married.And that's all that's left out of this whole relationship.So there's this iron with this little story.So buddy, you know, this museum of broken relationship essentially is a collection of breakups.Objects from breakups.Objects left over from breakups.And of course they try and choose ones with good stories.So this is from a broken romantic relationship, not like
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: a broken family relationship, not from broken sibling relationship.So all heartbreak for broken relationship.Weddings as well, broken marriages.So it is quite odd.Of course the objects are weird.There will be keys.There are of course mixed tapes.I don't know if you remember those.What is a tape buddy again?I don't know cassette tapes.I've never seen cassette tapes.Those things I used to make as a kid, not for my girlfriend.But at that point when you were a kid, I didn't have
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: money for records.So I would listen to the radio and record.You wait for the now for the next song.And then you hit record.You had to sit there and wait for the last minute.And the worst was always that DJ who insisted to talk into the intro.You know, like shut up.I want to start recording.And those are in the 80s that were mixed tapes.You would make a tape for your girlfriend.But of course now it doesn't take any effort.You could just download it and just pop it together and make up an mp3.But in those days it took a lot of effort
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: to make a mixtape for a girl.So they actually mentioned they have a lot of mixtapes.And the idea is that it sounds quite strange.So you go there and you look at these objects and you can read the story behind it.No names of course.But they say it is quite interesting.Well buddy, I would say this is something I would do because I think in retrospect I would look at it like it's always good to know stories of other people, number one.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: You listen to the stories.You know, whether they're sad, they're happy or whatever.You know, because we're human after all.And that's how we build empathy through understanding how other people feel.And not only that, but then you become, I would say, you know, I usually, if I do go to these kind of events or go to museums and see or hear these stories, I feel actually grateful at the end of the day and content about my life and the relationship that I've had, right?And be grateful for
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: them.You know, the lessons learned and grateful for family and friends.You know, I think it's not only interesting in terms of the story they present, but also a way for you to look at yourself and reflect and know that you have found love, you have been loved, and if you are in love, let's say, and that you're doing good.Well, that is the main thing.It is quite interesting that a lot of people go there.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: It really calls or...It brings back memory.It triggers your memories.And different things.Some people go there, they are sad.Some people go there to feel healed.Some people go there because they want some sympathy.They feel they're other broken heart.I feel lonely, so I can go there and I can enjoy it.Some people, they say families come in because parents feel it's a good place to bring their children, especially teenagers, to have a good environment to talk with them about these kinds of things.Because none of us can avoid heartache and heartbreak.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: It happens to all of us.So it's actually serving the strange precipice.And the other thing is it's not...Most people who go there are quite quiet and respectful.It's sort of a very...It's like going to a mausoleum, I suppose, which is like a graveyard.But it's a graveyard for relationships.But it brings about a lot of positive things as well.And this was the strange thing.As I said, they say that most of the people who go there are locals, not many tourists, because people don't go to LA.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: People from LA go there, as I said, and people go there for different reasons.Some just for interest, some to actually feel a bit of empathy for others.I think it is great because from the objects and the stories you can learn and it can help you in life.So it is for deeper reflection.The one object that...Well, there are two of them actually that interest me the most were two silicone implants.Come again?Silicone implants.The lady sent them to the
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: museum and she said...Put them on display.Put them on display because they are very important.She felt pressured by her partner, her boyfriend, to have them done so she would have bigger breasts.Unfortunately, her body didn't like them, rejected them, and afterwards she had to have multiple surgeries.To remove it.To remove it and to correct it.That's so broken.That is so broken.And then in the end the relationship didn't work.And it resonates in this area because in this part of the world,
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: a lot of ladies feel pressured to get these implants to be more attractive to their partners.And I think that is the key with that lesson of you have to...And she basically says that you have to learn to love yourself before you can love other people.You have to like yourself for who you are.Don't change because it's not worth it.And that was a key lesson.That's a great lesson.What a great lesson.Very good lesson I think for all of us who are not yet in romantic relationships or who are already
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: in a romantic relationship or whoever is married, you got to stay true to yourself and stay true to your partner.Great.Well, so if you're in LA, why don't you try and find out about the Museum of Broken Relationships and go and have a look.Some of the stories are very interesting.Or read the article.Please feel free to read it.There are a few more examples.Some of them are quite...Mundane.Mundane and some are quite interesting.I think they picked some of the best ones.Right.So let's go.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: My keywords out of the actual article were mundane which means basically boring.Boring?Every day there's nothing.How was your day?Mundane.Every day is the same.It's not boring.So can I say like I'm going to have a blue mundane.A blue mundane is coming.A mundane mundane.So yeah, grammatically that would be wrong but I mean you get the point.It's a good pun.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: It was a mundane movie.How was the class?It was mundane.The other word I liked was anonymously.This one is anonymously but I like the word anonymous.Anonymous.Which sometimes is abbreviated anon.Anon or anonymously means without a name.We don't know who it is.No name.So if I want to give money to a charity and I don't want my name published, I can do it anonymously.All right.I have an example for you, buddy.My example is a few days ago
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: were the Valentine's Day and if you are a secret admirer of some girl and you want to give her flowers but you want to make it secretive, you can send her an anonymous, right?An anonymous card.Say be my Valentine's anonymous so she wouldn't know who it's from and then own up a little bit later and say yeah, it was me and then get rejected ultimately and then send objects to the museum
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: and some public relations.There was an interesting story about a girl who bought a dress to wear to impress a boy and the boy killed himself so she never got to wear the dress and she sent that dress.They are sad ones too.Wow!That's very sad.That is.That was very sad.So I have sort of a phrase and if you don't mind I will just read it out.This is the lady who the silicon bracelet and she basically quoted, quote her as saying,she held onto them to remind herself don't change
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: You have to love yourself to be loved and to be in a productive relationship.That's so profound.That is profound.Buddy, why don't we slow down with that quote and let's read it again. Because I think this is for all the female listeners out there and for all the guys who are in love and want to protect your woman. This is how you do it.So I'll just go from the you part which is you have to love yourself to be loved and to be in a productive relationship.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_Taipei Banter 台北嘿掰講Ep.4 Museum of broken relationships.json

chunks.chunk_text: That's really deep.I think it's a lesson for life.Yes.I think we have to learn to like ourselves.To be happy.I definitely do like my chubby belly that I've been building up.Well done,John.I'm trying to lose mine.The one pack I've got.I always said I don't have a six pack.I have a wardrobe.That's a good one.That's a better one than my one pack, buddy.Or a case of beer.I don't have a six pack.

chunks.chunk_text: I have a case of beer.It's all 24.Right.So guys, do you have any objects or any comments regarding broken relationships?Please do write to us or comment in our blog at www.15mins.today.And remember, you've got to love yourself to be in a productive relationship.There you go.Have a good one, guys.Thank you.Cheers.Bye.
